fields.label: Before you start
fields.message: You can build and personalise your privacy policy page by adapting the text in the various content boxes and answering the following questions. Answering 'Yes' or 'No' to a question will enable different tabs and content boxes with related text that you can edit.

fields.label: Introductory Text
fields.name: privacy_general
fields.default_value:
This privacy policy is for {{ ORGANISATION NAME }}. We may change this Policy from time to time so please check this page occasionally to ensure that you’re happy with any changes. By using our website, you’re agreeing to be bound by this Policy. 

Any questions regarding this Policy and our privacy practices should be sent by email to {{ ENTER EMAIL / OTHER CONTACT OPTIONS }}.

sub_fields.default_value: {{ ORGANISATION NAME }} only collects personal information if you explicitly consent to any of the following:

sub_fields.label: Who has access to your information?
sub_fields.name: privacy_access
sub_fields.default_value: We will not sell or rent your information to third parties. We will not share your information with third parties for marketing purposes.

sub_fields.label: Who has access to your information?
sub_fields.name: privacy_access

sub_fields.label: Registered User Information
sub_fields.name: user_information_use
sub_fields.default_value: By default, {{ ORGANISATION NAME URL }} retains only your email address upon creating a user account.  You can consent to your name also being retained for the purposes of personalising your website experience.  Your email address will only be used to identify your account upon login and to provide you with any important updates about your account

sub_fields.label: Subscriber Information
sub_fields.name: subscriber_information_use
sub_fields.default_value: {{ ORGANISATION NAME }} maintains email lists to keep subscribers informed about news, events and publications related to our work. Users join our mailing lists voluntarily via email and by signing up through a form on our website. We retain only your email address and name, if the user consents, in order to deliver notifications you have consented to and to provide you with any important updates about your subscription.

sub_fields.label: Accessing and updating your information
sub_fields.name: access_and_updating
sub_fields.default_value:
The accuracy of your information is important to us. If you are a registered user you can log in to your account and visit your profile page in order to update any of your personal information. You can also remove your account in its entirety by using the 'Delete Account' button. You can also update any information we hold about your by emailing us at {{ CONTACT EMAIL }}.

If you wish to see what information {{ ORGANISATION NAME }} holds about you, please submit a request by email to {{ CONTACT EMAIL }} (Note on any charges to process these requests + alternative means of communication) 

It is {{ ORGANISATION NAME }}’s policy to ensure that all Information Access Requests are acknowledged in 5 working days.  
 
Individuals will be required to provide proof of identity and residence before information may be disclosed. This is to prevent unauthorised disclosure to third parties. 

Where a request is made by an agent on behalf of an individual, a request will only be fulfilled where the agent can provide proof of authority to act on the individual’s behalf. 

All requests will be dealt with within the timeframe set by the Information Commissioner (40 calendar days from proof of identity).

sub_fields.label: Communication Choices
sub_fields.name: communication_choices
sub_fields.default_value: You have a choice about whether or not you wish to receive information from us.  We will never send you unsolicited email, but we also understand that you may decide you no longer wish to receive certain communications from us.

sub_fields.label: To change your mailing list preferences
sub_fields.name: mailling_list_preferences
sub_fields.default_value: To unsubscribe from a mailing list you have previously subscribed to, you can click on the 'Unsubscribe' link that is found at the bottom of all emails sent to a mailing list.  Alternatively, contact SITE_EMAIL with details of the mailing list you would like to unsubscribe from.

sub_fields.label: To change your mailing list preferences
sub_fields.name: mailling_list_preferences

sub_fields.default_value: If on creating an account a communication choice is provided, note here how to update it

sub_fields.label: To change your account communication preferences
sub_fields.name: account_communication_preferences

sub_fields.label: How we protect your information
sub_fields.name: how_we_protect_your_information
sub_fields.default_value:
{{ SITE_URL }} uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) security technology to establish an encrypted link between our web server and your web browser. This link ensures that all data passed between the web server and browser remains private and integral.  

When you are on a secure page, a lock icon will appear in the browser address bar. 

Any of your information you provide us with is stored in a secure database. At no point will be ask you for sensitive information (such as credit or debit card details).

sub_fields.label: Text to show if your site does not set cookies
sub_fields.name: no_cookies_set
sub_fields.default_value: {{ ORGANISATION NAME }} does not set any cookies for website visitors.

sub_fields.label: Text to show if your site does not set cookies
sub_fields.name: no_cookies_set

sub_fields.label: What are cookies
sub_fields.name: use_of_cookies
sub_fields.instructions: This text will show on any page created using the 'Cookie Page' template. By default, it does not show on pages using the 'Privacy Policy' template.
sub_fields.default_value: Cookies are created when you visit a website that uses cookies. Cookies are small text files of letters and numbers. These files are either stored in the memory of your computer or other device such as mobile phones or tablet devices.

sub_fields.label: Controlling Cookies
sub_fields.name: user_control_cookies
sub_fields.instructions: This text will show on any page created using the 'Cookie Page' template. By default, it does not show on pages using the 'Privacy Policy' template.
sub_fields.default_value: You can control the use and placing of any cookies on your computer through the settings you select on your internet browser. You can change your browser settings to accept or refuse all cookies, choose which cookies you want or don’t want, or ask to be notified when a cookie is set. You can use the help feature in your browser to see how. However, if you use your browser settings to block all cookies you may experience reduced functionality when accessing certain services on YOUR SITE URL. Useful information about controlling cookies can be found at http://www.aboutcookies.org/.

sub_fields.label: Cookies used by this site
sub_fields.name: cookies_used_text
sub_fields.instructions: This text will show on any page created using the 'Cookie Page' template. By default, it does not show on pages using the 'Privacy Policy' template.
sub_fields.default_value:
The list below describes the cookies we use on this site and what we use them for. Currently we operate an ‘opt in consent’ policy which means that you accept or reject the usage of cookies by THIS SITE URL. If you have previously accepted cookie usage, but have changed your mind, you can revoke this consent using the button below.  Although cookies assist in the functioning of this website, you will still be able to use THIS SITE URL without consenting to their use , or you should delete the cookies having visited the site, or you should browse the site using your browser’s anonymous usage setting (called “Incognito” in Chrome, “InPrivate” for Internet Explorer, “Private Browsing” in Firefox and Safari etc.) 

By accessing and using our websites, you are agreeing to the terms of this policy and our privacy policy. We may update this cookie policy from time to time and will post any changes on this page.

sub_fields.label: Cookies set for registered Users
sub_fields.name: wp_cookies_text
sub_fields.instructions: This text will show on any page created using the 'Cookie Page' template. By default, it does not show on pages using the 'Privacy Policy' template.
sub_fields.default_value: Our website runs the WordPress content management system and cookies are used to store basic data on your interactions with the website, and whether you have logged into WordPress. On login, wordpress uses the wordpress_[hash] cookie to store your authentication details. Its use is limited to the admin console area. After login, wordpress sets the wordpress_logged_in_[hash] cookie, which indicates when you're logged in, and who you are, for most interface use. WordPress also sets wp-settings-{time}-[UID] cookies. The number on the end is your individual user ID from the users database table. This is used to customize your view of admin interface (if you have access to it), and possibly also the main site interface. The actual cookies contain hashed data, so you don't have to worry about someone gleaning your username and password by reading the cookie data. A hash is the result of a specific mathematical formula applied to some input data (in this case your user name and password, respectively). It's quite hard to reverse a hash (bordering on practical infeasibility with today's computers). This means it is very difficult to take a hash and "unhash" it to find the original input data. When a visitor comments on an article published on YOUR SITE URL, cookies are stored on their computer. This is purely a convenience, so that the visitor won't need to re-type all their information again when they want to leave another comment. Three cookies are set for commenters: comment_author_{HASH} comment_author_email_{HASH} comment_author_url_{HASH} The commenter cookies are set to expire a little under one year from the time they're set.

sub_fields.label: Text to show if your site sets analytics cookies
sub_fields.name: analytics_cookies_text
sub_fields.instructions: This text will show on any page created using the 'Cookie Page' template. By default, it does not show on pages using the 'Privacy Policy' template.
sub_fields.default_value: Analytics cookies collect information about how you use our website. These cookies do not gather information about you that could be used for marketing purposes. The information is used to help us improve how our website works and understand what interest our users. __utm.gif This is Google Analytics Tracking Code that logs details about the visitor's browser and computer. Set for browsing session. __utma This is used to distinguish users and sessions. The cookie is updated every time data is sent to Google Analytics. Set for 2 years. __utmb This is used to determine new sessions/visits. The cookie is updated every time data is sent to Google Analytics. Set for browsing session. __utmc This is used by Google Analytics to calculate the duration of a website visit. Set for browsing session. __utmt This is used to throttle the speed of requests to the server. Set for browsing session. __utmz This stores the traffic source or campaign that explains how the user reached your site. The cookie is updated every time data is sent to Google Analytics. Set for 6 months. You may reject or delete Google Analytics cookies by downloading and installing the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on.

sub_fields.label: Text to show if your site sets analytics cookies
sub_fields.name: analytics_cookies_text

sub_fields.label: Cookies Policy Page Link
sub_fields.name: cookies_page_link
sub_fields.instructions: To keep the privacy policy more readable, we recommend creating a separate page for your cookie policy (selecting the 'Cookie Page' template from the 'Page Attribute' options on the right hand side).  Then you can link to the cookie policy page here.

sub_fields.label: Links to other sites
sub_fields.name: links_to_other_sites
sub_fields.default_value:
Our website may contain links to other websites run by other organisations. This privacy policy applies only to {{ SITE URL }}. We are not responsible for the privacy policies of these sites. 

In addition, if you linked to our website from a third party site, are not responsible for the privacy policies of the third party site and recommend you check the policy of that site.
